intro: Tenaris chlorantha, commonly known as the yellow flax, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are alternate and have a distinctive, slightly hairy texture. Tenaris chlorantha is often found in grasslands and along riverbanks, where it contributes to local biodiversity.
